c74object.name: bach.neuralnet
c74object.description: Implements a feed-forwards or recurrent neural network with an arbitrary number of layers

inlet.digest: The values of the input nodes, to be feeded to the network
The training data in llll form

outlet.digest: The output data for the incoming input data
Dump outlet for the state of the network

outlet.description: The advancement is a floating point value between 0 (training starts) and 1 (training ends)

outlet.digest: Output training results when training has ended
outlet.description: The output message is in the form (TS_accuracy GS_accuracy VS_accuracy) (TS_mse GS_mse VS_mse) where TS is the training set, GS is the generalization set, VS is the validation set, and mse is the mean squared error.

objarg.name: recurrent
objarg.description: If the first argument is the symbole "recurrent", the neural network will be instantiated as a RNN (recurrent neural network), otherwise it will be a feed-forward neural network (default).

objarg.name: in
objarg.description: Sets the number of nodes in the input layer of the neural network.

objarg.name: hidden
objarg.digest: Number of hidden nodes for each inner layer
objarg.description: Sets the number of nodes in each of the hidden layers of the neural network (the number of layers will match the number of integers)

objarg.name: out
objarg.description: Sets the number of nodes in the output layer of the neural network.

method.name: bang
method.digest: Train network with last used training data.
method.description: A bang in the second inlet will train the network with the last used training data.

method.name: dump
method.description: The dump message dumps the network state (model) from the second outlet. This is an llll having the form NEURONS WEIGHTS. The NEURONS llll is in the form (INPUT HIDDENLAYER1 HIDDENLAYER2... OUTPUT) and contains the wrapped lists of the activation values of all neurons in each one of the layers. If the network is not recurrent, the WEIGHTS llll is in the form (InputToHidden1 Hidden1ToHidden2 ... LastHiddenLayerToOutput) where each one of the sub elements is indeed a matrix containing all the weights to pass from a given layer to the next one. If the network is recurrent, between any two elements of such lists are interleaved the weights for passing from a layer to itself, yielding the form (InputToHidden1 Hidden1ToHidden1 Hidden1ToHidden2 Hidden2ToHidden2 ... LastHiddenLayerToLastHiddenLayer LastHiddenLayerToOutput)

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in first inlet is considered as a list of input values to be fed to the network. The corresponding output values are output from the first outlet. An llll in second inlet is considered as a list of training items; each item must be in the form ((input1 input2...) (target1 target2...)) containing the inputs and the expected targets for such inputs. Once the training is over, a message containing the results is output through the third outlet (see outlet documentation for more information).

method.name: read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains is considered to be the model (network state) The input model must be an llll of the same form as the one output by the dump message (see dump for more information).

method.name: reset
method.description: The reset message in the second inlet resets the weights of the network to random values, the neurons activation values to 0, and resets the obtained training results. If the reset message is followed by one of the symbols weights, neurons, results, only the corresponding data is reset, while the others are preserved.

method.name: setstate
method.description: An llll after the setstate message sets the state to the network to the input model. The input model must be an llll of the same form as the one output by the dump message (see dump for more information).

method.name: stop
method.description: A stop message will cause the training to stop immediately.

method.name: write
method.digest: Save network state in native format
method.description: A write message will save the network state in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up.

method.name: writetxt
method.digest: Save network state in text format
method.description: A writetxt message will save the network state in a file, in readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up.

attribute.name: activationfunction
attribute.description: Chooses the activation function for each neuron.

attribute.name: batchlearning
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to operate in batch learning mode.

attribute.name: bpttsteps
attribute.description: Sets the length of the history for backpropagation through time (only used by recurrent networks).

attribute.name: classificationtolerance
attribute.description: Sets the maximum tolerance allowed for validity check in classification problems. For instance, if classificationtolerance is 0.1 (default), an output value of 0.09 will be considered correct in case the target value should have been 0. This is used in order to determine whether a pattern is correctly classified in order to properly compute the accuracy ration (also see desiredaccuracy).

attribute.name: datasetmode
attribute.description:
Sets the approach to building the dataset starting from the training data:
Static: The database is built
Growing: The dat
Selected: Only show numbers when the corresponding point is selected
Always: Always show all the numbers

attribute.name: datasetsplit
attribute.description: Sets the splitting ratios for generalization and validation segments of the dataset. For instance, 0.6 0.9 means that the 60% of the databased is used for training, the following 30% is used for generalization and the last 10% is used for validation

attribute.name: datasetstep
attribute.description: Sets the ratio of the database representing the database growth (for Growing datasetmode) or the dataset shift (for Windowing datasetmode). This attribute is ignored with Static datasetmode.

attribute.name: datasetwin
attribute.description: Sets the size of the window for Windowing datasetmode, as a ratio on the whole training data. Must be bigger or equal to datasetstep size.

attribute.name: desiredaccuracy
attribute.description: Sets the desired accuracy for the training and generalization sets. The accuracy is the ratio between correctly classified patterns and whole training/generalization patterns. Once the training has reached the desiredaccuracy on both training and generalization sets, the training ends, even if maxepochs is not yet reached. Set this attribute to 0 (default) if you simply want to run the training in any case till maxepochs is reached (or till desiredmse is reached, if set).

attribute.name: desiredmse
attribute.description: Sets the desired mean squared error for the training and generalization sets. The mean squared error is is the average of the sum of the squared errors (desired â€“ actual) for each pattern in the training/generalization set. Once the training has reached the desiredmse on both training and generalization sets, the training ends, even if maxepochs is not yet reached. Set this attribute to 0 (default) if you simply want to run the training in any case till maxepochs is reached (or till desiredaccuracy is reached, if set).

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: When set to 1, the trained model is saved with the patcher and will be available, already charged, next time the patch is loaded.

attribute.name: learningrate
attribute.description: Sets the learning rate for the neural net, defaults to 0.001.

attribute.name: maxepochs
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of epochs to be run while training.

attribute.name: momentum
attribute.description: Sets the momentum for the neural net, defaults to 0.9.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.
llllobj_class_add_check_attr(c, LLLL_OBJ_VANILLA);

attribute.name: parallel
attribute.description: When set to 1, the training is performed in a separate thread. This means that the normal Max operation is not interrupted. The parallel attribute is highly experimental and can lead to serious problems, including data corruption and crashes. In general, it is essential that the patch is not saved or closed as long as the search is going on. Such operations are more than likely to crash Max.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to verbosely print training information in the Max window (if verbose == 1) or from the last outlet, in the form verbose epoch (TSaccuracy TSmeansquarederror) (GSaccuracy GSmeansquarederror). Some acronyms are used, namely: TS = Training Set, GS = Generalization Set, VS = Validation Set.

c74object.discussion: The training is achieved via feed forwarding and then backpropagation through gradient descent. The algorithm can operate both in stochastic and in batch mode. Even for recurrent neural networks, currently, only standard backpropagation is used (no backpropagation through time).
